snippet: After a blizzard, self-reliant South Dakotans feel invisible as the federal workers who would normally assist them are furloughed because of the government shutdown.
abstract: Self-reliant South Dakota ranchers who are struggling to deal with effects of blizzard that killed tens of thousands of livestock are feeling invisible as the federal workers who would normally assist them are furloughed because of the government shutdown.
lead_paragraph: After a blizzard, self-reliant South Dakotans feel invisible as the federal workers who would normally assist them are furloughed because of the government shutdown.

headline.main: South Dakota Ranchers Face Storm’s Toll, but U.S.’ Helping Hands Are Tied
headline.print_headline: As Ranchers Face Storm’s Toll, U.S.’ Helping Hands Are Tied
